intro: Smyrnium creticum, commonly known as the Cretan cowbane, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender stems with finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Smyrnium creticum is known for its toxic properties, containing compounds that can be harmful to livestock and humans if ingested.
